title: Nutritional Education Design Process Using Problem-Based Learning and Communities of Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental Nutrition Concepts and Basic Educational Knowledge
context.additional_context: A Course for Pre-Service Teachers to Strengthen Nutrition Education Competencies Through Real-Life Problem Solving. Includes Blended Activities Using Digital Devices (Tablets/Laptops)

learning_goals: Learners can analyze nutrition-related problems occurring in actual school settings and propose solutions by applying the PBL framework.
Through Community of Inquiry (CoI) activities, learners can collaboratively develop educational materials and provide feedback via peer learning with fellow teachers.
Learners can design lesson plans incorporating social, cognitive, and teaching presences and develop immediately applicable educational modules.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
